Docs.summary: Mono.Desklets is a set of tools to run small applications built with Moonlight/Silverlight(tm) on your Linux desktop using Mono's Moonlight.

remarks.para: Desklets are basically Silverlight applications that have been transported from the Web to the desktop. Unlike their Web counterparts, these desklets run with the full Mono API, not the subset that is part of Silverlight and they run with full trust on the desktop.

To launch a desklet you would typically use the mopen command or double click on the default.xaml file on your desktop (if the mopen command has been associated with the XAML mime type in your Linux installation).

A simple desklet can be as simple as a XAML file with animations embedded into it. But most desklets will likely have some logic written in another language to add the special behaviour for each desklet. To do this, you typically reference an assembly from your XAML file and specify the namespace that will instantiate this class (using the x:Class attribute in your toplevel Canvas declaration referencing the assembly, like this: x:Class="Clock.Display;assembly=bin/clock.dll"). You can use the Loaded property of any of the UIElements to trigger the execution of a particular method in the assembly, for example: Loaded="PageLoaded".
